title: YNote: A Novel Music Notation for Fine-Tuning LLMs in Music Generation
author: Shao-Chien Lu (Yuan Ze University), Chen-Chen Yeh (Yuan Ze University), Hui-Lin Cho (Yuan Ze University), Chun-Chieh Hsu (Yuan Ze University), Tsai-Ling Hsu (Yuan Ze University), Cheng-Han Wu (National Central University), Timothy K. Shih (National Central University), Yu-Cheng Lin (Yuan Ze University)
relevance_why: The development of a simplified music notation system (YNote) could enhance audio generation models by enabling easier data encoding and decoding for musical content, potentially benefiting Haohe Liu's research in audio generation and processing.
background: YNote is designed to provide a user-friendly, fixed format for music notation, facilitating easier training of large language models (LLMs) for music generation tasks.
contribution: YNote introduces a simplified music notation system to solve the complexity of existing formats, achieving effective fine-tuning of GPT-2 for music generation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional formats like MIDI, ABC Notation, and MusicXML are complex and difficult for machines to parse.
technical_comparison.novelty: YNote simplifies the representation using only four characters for pitches, streamlining the encoding process and enhancing machine learning model training.

key_innovation: YNote's fixed-format representation for notes balances human readability with machine learning utility, improving the model's ability to generate coherent music.
real_world_impact: YNote could significantly improve the generation of music using LLMs, offering composers a tool for creating music more intuitively. Its simplicity may lower barriers for new entrants in musical AI applications.
limitations: Some special notes cannot be represented in YNote format, which may limit its applicability for more complex musical compositions.

new_terms.BLEU: **BLEU** is a metric for evaluating the quality of text generated by a machine, comparing it with reference text by measuring n-gram overlaps.
new_terms.ROUGE: **ROUGE** is a set of metrics for evaluating the quality of summaries by counting the overlap of n-grams between the generated content and reference content.
